steps: Rinse the dal thoroughly and pressure cook it with water and turmeric powder until soft and mashed (about 4 whistles).
In a separate small pan, heat ghee or oil for the tempering (tadka).
Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add garlic, dry red chili, and asafoetida. Fry for 30 seconds until garlic turns light brown.
Pour the tempering over the cooked dal. Mix well and serve hot with rice or roti.
Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Reserve about 1 cup of the pasta water.
While pasta cooks, crisp the guanciale/pancetta in a skillet until golden. Remove from heat, leaving the rendered fat in the pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, whole egg, Pecorino cheese, and black pepper.
Drain the pasta and immediately add it to the skillet with the fat. Toss quickly.

Remove the skillet from the burner. Pour the egg/cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing vigorously and constantly. Add a small amount of reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce, but avoid scrambling the eggs.
Serve immediately, topped with extra Pecorino and black pepper.

recipeName: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Salmon and Asparagus
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a sheet pan with parchment paper.
Toss asparagus with 1 tbsp of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on one half of the sheet pan.
Place salmon fillets on the other half.
Drizzle salmon with remaining olive oil and sprinkle with dill, salt, and pepper. Place lemon slices on top of the salmon.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flaky.
Serve immediately.
Rinse and parboil the beef bones for 10 minutes, then drain and rinse again.
Char the onions and ginger over an open flame or under a broiler until slightly blackened.
Toast the star anise, cinnamon, and fennel seeds in a dry pan until fragrant.
Combine bones, charred vegetables, and spices in a large stockpot with 6 liters of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 6-8 hours, skimming impurities regularly.
Strain the broth. Season with fish sauce and sugar.
Soak and cook rice noodles. Assemble bowls with noodles, raw beef slices, and desired garnishes (basil, lime, sprouts).
Pour hot broth over the ingredients to cook the beef and serve immediately.
Scoop the flesh of the avocados into a food processor or high-speed blender.
Add cocoa powder, maple syrup, plant milk, vanilla extract, and salt.
Process until the mixture is completely smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides as needed.
Taste and adjust sweetness or liquid if necessary.
Divide the mousse into serving cups and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to chill and firm up.
Garnish with fresh berries or mint before serving.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add diced chicken and stir-fry until cooked through and lightly browned. Remove chicken and set aside.
Add broccoli florets to the wok and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce (or Tamari), keto sweetener, ginger, and garlic.
Return the chicken to the wok. Pour the sauce over the chicken and broccoli.
Toss quickly to coat everything. Cook for 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Serve hot.

recipeName: Classic French Onion Soup (Soupe à l'Oignon)
steps: In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Add the sliced onions and sugar.
Cook the onions slowly for 45-60 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deeply caramelized and brown.
Stir in the flour, then deglaze the pot with white wine, scraping up any browned bits. Cook until the wine has evaporated.
Pour in the beef broth. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 20 minutes.
Preheat the broiler. Ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls.
Place a slice of bread on top of the soup in each bowl, then cover generously with Gruyère cheese.
Broil until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and golden brown. Serve immediately.

recipeName: Moroccan Chicken Tagine with Apricots and Almonds
steps: Season the chicken with salt and pepper. In a large pot or tagine, brown the chicken in olive oil in batches. Set aside.
Add the chopped onion to the pot and cook until soft.
Stir in the Ras el Hanout, ginger, and saffron. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Return the chicken to the pot. Add chicken broth and dried apricots. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the chicken is tender.
Toast the slivered almonds lightly in a dry pan.
Adjust seasoning. Garnish with toasted almonds and serve over couscous or rice.
In a jar or container, combine the rolled oats, plant milk, chia seeds, maple syrup (if using), and cinnamon.
Stir well to ensure the chia seeds are fully incorporated and prevent clumping.
Layer the mixed berries on top or stir them into the mixture.
Seal the container and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or preferably overnight.
In the morning, stir the mixture and serve cold. Add more liquid if the consistency is too thick.
If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least 30 minutes.
In a bowl, combine coconut aminos, olive oil, smoked paprika, and garlic powder to create the marinade.
Add the cubed beef and toss to coat. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Thread the beef, red pepper, zucchini, and red onion onto the skewers.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the skewers for 4-5 minutes per side, or until the beef reaches desired doneness. Brush with any remaining marinade during grilling.
Serve hot.
Soak cashews in hot water for at least 30 minutes.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft.
Add garlic and basil; cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.
Carefully transfer the soup mixture to a blender.
Drain the cashews and add them to the blender. Blend until perfectly smooth and creamy.
Return the soup to the pot to reheat if necessary. Season with salt and pepper and serve.
Heat a splash of oil in a pot over medium heat. Add the green curry paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in half of the coconut milk and bring to a simmer, stirring until the paste is dissolved.
Add the tofu cubes and all the vegetables (bell pepper, bamboo shoots, broccoli).
Pour in the remaining coconut milk. Season with soy sauce/Tamari and brown sugar.
Bring back to a gentle simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, until vegetables are tender and tofu is heated through.
Serve hot over jasmine rice.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked and cooled quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, crumbled feta, Kalamata olives, and fresh parsley.
In a small separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil and red wine vinegar to create the dressing. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients.
Toss gently to ensure everything is evenly coated.
Chill for at least 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

ingredients.name: Butter (or olive oil for Dairy Free)

steps: In a large skillet, melt butter or heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant (do not let it burn).
Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and cooked through. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour in white wine and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer and cook for 1 minute.
Add the zucchini noodles (zoodles) to the skillet. Toss gently for 1-2 minutes; do not overcook as they will become soggy.
Stir in the fresh parsley. Serve immediately.
Pat the beef dry and season with salt and pepper. Dredge lightly in flour.
In a Dutch oven, cook the diced bacon until crisp. Remove bacon bits and reserve the fat.
Brown the beef cubes in batches in the bacon fat. Remove and set aside.
Add pearl onions and mushrooms to the pot and cook until softened.
Stir in tomato paste. Return the beef to the pot.
Pour in the wine and enough beef broth to just cover the meat. Add the reserved bacon bits and a bay leaf. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and braise in a 325°F (160°C) oven for 3 to 4 hours, or until the meat is fork-tender. Skim excess fat before serving.
dietaryRestrictions: Gluten Free (omit flour and use cornstarch for thickening)

steps: In a medium bowl, mash the ripe banana until smooth.
Whisk in the eggs and vanilla extract until well combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the GF flour blend and baking powder.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating with the milk, mixing just until combined (do not overmix).
Heat a lightly oiled non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the skillet.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with maple syrup and fruit.

ingredients.name: Large Shrimp (peeled and deveined, tail on)

steps: Heat the vegetable oil in a deep pot to 350°F (175°C).
Gently mix the tempura flour and ice-cold water until just combined (lumps are fine). Do not overmix.
Dust the shrimp and vegetables lightly with dry tempura flour.
Dip each piece into the batter, allowing excess to drip off.
Carefully drop the battered items into the hot oil, working in small batches to avoid overcrowding.
Fry for 2-3 minutes until light golden brown and crispy. Drain on a wire rack.
Serve immediately with a dipping sauce.
Season chicken thighs with garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken thighs until golden brown on both sides. Remove and set aside.
Add the diced onion to the pot and cook until softened.
Stir in the uncooked rice for 1 minute to toast it slightly.
Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low.
Nestle the seared chicken thighs back into the rice. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, or until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
In a food processor or with a hand mixer, blend the softened cream cheese and eggs until completely smooth.
Add the almond flour, baking powder, Erythritol, and vanilla extract. Blend until the batter is uniform.
Heat a griddle or non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly grease.
Pour batter onto the griddle to form small pancakes.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges are set (about 3 minutes), then flip and cook the other side for 2 minutes.
Serve with sugar-free syrup and berries.
In a large pot, sauté the chopped onion in a little oil until soft.
Stir in the chili powder and cumin, cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in all three types of beans.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for at least 30 minutes, allowing the flavors to deepen.
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cayenne (optional).
Serve hot with toppings like avocado or cilantro.
Whisk together flour, eggs, milk, water, and 1 tbsp melted butter until smooth. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Make the crêpes: Heat a non-stick pan. Pour a thin layer of batter and cook until edges are set, then flip and cook briefly. Repeat for all crêpes.
Prepare the sauce: In a large skillet, melt the remaining butter and sugar. Cook until the sugar caramelizes slightly.
Add the orange juice and orange zest. Bring to a simmer.
Fold the crêpes into quarters and place them in the sauce, allowing them to warm and absorb the flavor.
For the flambé (optional but classic): Pour the liqueur over the crêpes and carefully ignite with a long match. Let the flame die down completely before serving.
Serve immediately, spooning extra sauce over the top.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, mix the peanut butter, sugar, and egg until a uniform dough forms.
Roll the dough into small balls (about 1 inch) and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Use a fork to press a criss-cross pattern onto the top of each cookie.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly browned.
Let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
In a small bowl, combine the drained tuna, mayonnaise, and chopped celery. Season with salt and pepper.
Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Place two slices of bread, butter-side down, in a skillet over medium heat.
Place one slice of cheese on each bread slice.
Divide the tuna mixture and spread it over one of the cheese slices.
Top with the remaining bread slice, butter-side up.
Grill for 3-4 minutes per side, until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
In a large bowl, use a hand mixer to beat the cream cheese until light and fluffy.
Add the melted coconut oil, powdered Erythritol, and vanilla extract. Beat until fully incorporated and smooth.
Gently fold in the chopped raspberries.
Spoon the mixture into silicone mini-muffin molds or onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate or freeze for at least 1 hour until completely firm.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer. Serve cold.
Sear the beef tenderloin quickly on all sides in hot oil until nicely browned. Brush liberally with Dijon mustard.
Make the duxelles: Sauté the finely chopped mushrooms until all the moisture has evaporated. Season and cool.
Lay out a sheet of plastic wrap. Arrange the prosciutto slices in a slightly overlapping rectangle.
Spread the cooled mushroom duxelles evenly over the prosciutto.
Place the seared tenderloin at one end. Use the plastic wrap to tightly roll the prosciutto and duxelles around the beef. Chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out the puff pastry. Remove the beef from the plastic wrap and wrap it tightly in the pastry. Crimp the edges to seal.
Brush the pastry with egg wash. Score the top for decoration.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 35-45 minutes until the pastry is golden brown and the beef is medium-rare (internal temp 130°F/54°C). Rest before slicing.
Prepare the dough: Mix flour, ghee, and water until a stiff dough forms. Knead briefly and let rest for 30 minutes.
Prepare the filling: Sauté cumin powder, garam masala, and peas. Add mashed potatoes, amchur, salt, and mix well.
Divide the dough into balls. Roll each ball into an oval shape and cut in half to form two semicircles.
Take one semicircle, wet the straight edge, and fold into a cone shape. Fill with potato mixture and seal the third edge to form a triangle.
Deep fry the samosas over low heat for 15-20 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

recipeName: Paleo Sweet Potato Toast with Avocado
steps: Slice the sweet potato lengthwise into 1/4 inch thick slices, resembling bread slices.

Place the slices directly into a toaster and toast on the highest setting 2-3 times until tender in the middle and slightly crisp on the edges. Alternatively, bake in a toaster oven at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes.
While the 'toast' cooks, mash the avocado with lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Top the warm sweet potato slices generously with the mashed avocado.
Sprinkle with red pepper flakes for a touch of heat. Serve immediately.
In a large bowl, combine the mashed black beans, bread crumbs (or oats), chopped onion, BBQ sauce, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Mix well until the mixture holds its shape, adding a little more bread crumbs if too wet.
Form the mixture into 4 patties.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook the patties for 5-7 minutes per side, until browned and heated through.
Serve on buns (or lettuce wraps for GF/Keto) with your favorite toppings.
In a heatproof bowl set over a pot of simmering water (double boiler), whisk egg yolks and sugar until thick, pale, and increased in volume (about 5-7 minutes). Remove from heat and cool.
Gently fold the cooled yolk mixture into the mascarpone cheese until smooth.
Mix the cooled espresso and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger into the coffee mixture (do not soak) and arrange a single layer in a 9x13 inch dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Add a second layer of coffee-dipped ladyfingers.
Top with the remaining mascarpone mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
Just before serving, dust generously with cocoa powder.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sesame oil, and grated ginger to create the poke marinade.
Add the cubed tuna to the marinade and gently toss to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for 15-30 minutes.
Assemble the bowl: Scoop the cooked sushi rice into the base of the bowl.
Arrange the marinated tuna over the rice.
Add the edamame and sliced avocado as toppings.
Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
In a food processor, combine the tahini and lemon juice. Process for 1 minute, scraping down the sides. The mixture will lighten.
Add the crushed garlic and process briefly.
Add the drained chickpeas, salt, and pepper. Process for 2-3 minutes.
While the machine is running, slowly stream in the reserved chickpea liquid (aquafaba) until the hummus reaches a creamy, light consistency.
Taste and adjust seasoning or lemon juice.
Transfer to a serving bowl, drizzle with olive oil, and garnish with paprika or parsley. Serve with pita bread or vegetables.
Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add the cubed chicken and cook until browned. Set aside.
Add the red curry paste and turmeric powder to the pot. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Return the chicken to the pot. Cover and cook for 15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Stir in the spinach until wilted. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with cauli-rice or by itself.
In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium-low heat.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook gently for 5-7 minutes until the garlic is fragrant but not browned.
Crush the whole peeled tomatoes by hand directly into the pan, or pulse briefly in a food processor. Pour into the pan.
Add dried oregano and the pinch of sugar. Season generously with salt and pepper.
Bring the sauce to a bare simmer. Cook uncovered for at least 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens and the flavor deepens.
Serve over pasta, or use as a base for pizza or other dishes.
Ensure the beef is of the highest quality and kept very cold throughout the process.
Finely hand-chop the beef tenderloin. Do not use a food processor.
In a chilled bowl, gently combine the chopped beef, minced shallots, capers, cornichons, Dijon mustard, and olive oil.
Season heavily with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Taste and adjust seasonings, adding more mustard or capers as desired.
Plate the tartare, forming it into a neat round using a ring mold.
Create a small well in the center and carefully place a raw egg yolk on top.
Serve immediately with toasted bread or potato chips.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the chicken breast halves on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Brush each piece of chicken with a layer of olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven. Spread 1 tablespoon of pesto over each chicken breast.
Top with a slice of tomato and a sprinkle of shredded mozzarella cheese.
Return to the oven for another 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot.
dietaryRestrictions: Vegetarian (use halloumi or tofu instead of chicken)

recipeName: Vegan Red Lentil Soup (Turkish Mercimek Çorbası)
steps: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and carrot; sauté until soft.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add the rinsed red lentils and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until the lentils are completely soft.
Use an immersion blender to purée the soup until smooth (or carefully transfer to a regular blender).
Season with salt, pepper, and dried mint.
Serve hot with a wedge of lemon.
Blanch the bones in boiling water for 10 minutes, then rinse them clean.
Char the ginger and onions lightly over a gas burner or in a dry pan.
Place the clean bones, charred vegetables, water, shiitake mushrooms, and kombu in a large stockpot.
Bring to a rolling boil, then immediately reduce the heat to a very low simmer (just a bubble every few seconds).
Simmer the broth for 6-8 hours, skimming impurities frequently.
Strain the broth carefully. Season the base (tari) with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve with cooked noodles, meat/tofu, and a soft-boiled egg.
Brown the ground chicken in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain any excess fat.
Add the chopped water chestnuts and shredded carrots to the chicken. Cook for 5 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in the soy sauce/Tamari, Hoisin sauce, and Sriracha.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce is reduced and coats the mixture.
Remove from heat.
Spoon the chicken mixture into the prepared butter lettuce cups. Serve immediately.
dietaryRestrictions: Gluten Free (using Tamari and GF Hoisin)

steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Mix graham crumbs and melted butter; press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
In a large bowl, beat the softened cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
Beat in the sour cream and vanilla extract.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing only until just combined.
Pour the filling over the crust. Place the springform pan in a larger roasting pan and fill the outer pan with hot water (water bath).
Bake for 60-75 minutes, until the edges are set and the center is still slightly jiggly.
Turn off the oven, prop the door open, and allow the cheesecake to cool slowly for 1 hour.
Remove from water bath, cool completely on a rack, then chill in the refrigerator for at least 8 hours before serving.
Add all ingredients (spinach, frozen banana, pineapple, coconut water, and chia seeds) into a high-powered blender.
Blend on high until the mixture is perfectly smooth and has no remaining spinach clumps.
Add more liquid if the smoothie is too thick, or more frozen fruit if it's too thin.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
Make the salsa verde: Boil tomatillos and jalapeños until soft (about 10 minutes). Blend with cilantro and a splash of water until smooth.
In a skillet, heat a little oil and fry the salsa verde for 5 minutes. Season with salt.
Dip each corn tortilla briefly in the hot salsa verde.
Fill the dipped tortilla with shredded chicken, roll it up, and place seam-side down in a baking dish.
Pour any remaining salsa over the rolled enchiladas.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 15-20 minutes until heated through and bubbling.
Garnish with crumbled Queso Fresco and a drizzle of Crema Mexicana before serving.

recipeName: Pescatarian Fish Tacos with Cabbage Slaw
steps: Cut fish fillets into strips. Season with chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and cook the fish strips for 3-4 minutes per side until cooked through and flaky.
Make the slaw: Combine shredded cabbage, mayonnaise, and lime juice. Season lightly.
Warm the corn tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
Assemble the tacos: Place cooked fish in the center of a warm tortilla. Top generously with the cabbage slaw.
Garnish with cilantro and a final squeeze of lime juice. Serve immediately.
Make the detrempe (dough): Mix flour, milk, water, sugar, yeast, and salt. Knead until smooth. Rest in the fridge for 1 hour.
Prepare the butter block (beurrage): Shape the cold butter into a square block between parchment papers.
Lamination: Enclose the butter block in the detrempe. Perform three single folds (turns) with 1 hour of chilling time between each fold. This creates the layers.
Shape the croissants: Roll the dough to a thin rectangle. Cut into triangles. Roll each triangle from the base towards the point.
Proofing: Let the shaped croissants proof at room temperature for 2-3 hours until puffy (this is critical).
Baking: Brush with egg wash. Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 15-20 minutes until golden brown and flaky.
Cool on a rack and serve.
In a large bowl, mix warm water, yeast, and sugar. Let stand for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
Add the flour, salt, and olive oil. Mix until a shaggy dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in an oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1-1.5 hours, or until doubled in size.
Punch the dough down and divide it in half (for two pizzas).
Roll or stretch the dough into desired pizza shapes and add toppings.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 10-15 minutes.
Grate the zucchini and place it in a cheesecloth or thick paper towel. Squeeze out as much liquid as possible—this is crucial for crispy fritters.
In a medium bowl, combine the squeezed zucchini, almond flour, egg, parsley, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Mix well until just combined.
Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Spoon heaping tablespoons of the mixture into the hot oil and flatten gently with a spatula.
Cook for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot with a dollop of coconut yogurt or salsa.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve about 1 cup of the starchy pasta water before draining.
While the pasta cooks, prepare the sauce: In a large bowl, whisk together the ricotta, Parmesan cheese, lemon zest, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Add the drained pasta to the bowl with the ricotta mixture.
Toss quickly, adding the reserved pasta water a little at a time until the sauce is creamy and coats the pasta evenly.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra lemon zest.
Marinate the chicken: Combine chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and 1 tsp garam masala. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat broiler or grill. Cook the marinated chicken until slightly charred and cooked through. Set aside.
Make the sauce: Melt butter/ghee in a pan. Sauté the remaining ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Stir in crushed tomatoes. Cook for 10 minutes until the oil separates.
Stir in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Add the cooked chicken.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Serve hot over basmati rice or with naan.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Scoop out a small amount of avocado flesh from the center of each half to create a larger well for the egg.
Crack one egg into the well of each avocado half. The egg white may overflow slightly.
Sprinkle the top of each egg with shredded cheese, salt, and pepper.
Place the avocado halves in a small baking dish to keep them steady.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolk is cooked to your preference.
Garnish with chopped chives and serve immediately.
Make the filling: Sauté the diced onion until soft. Add the cooked lentils, mixed vegetables, vegetable broth, and tomato paste.
Season with herbs like thyme and rosemary, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Make the mash: Mash the boiled potatoes with plant milk, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Transfer the lentil filling to a baking dish.
Spoon or pipe the mashed potatoes evenly over the filling to cover completely.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the filling is bubbling hot.
Allow to cool slightly before serving.
Pour cold water into a small bowl and sprinkle the gelatin over it (this is called blooming). Let stand for 5-10 minutes.
In a saucepan, combine the heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla extract. Heat over medium heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves (do not boil).
Remove the cream mixture from the heat and stir in the bloomed gelatin until it is completely dissolved.
Pour the mixture into individual serving ramekins or small glasses.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or until the panna cotta is firm and set.
Top with fruit puree (like berry or passionfruit) before serving.
Heat coconut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the mixed vegetables and ginger. Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Push the vegetables to one side. Pour the whisked eggs into the empty side of the pan and scramble them. Break them into small pieces.
Add the riced cauliflower and stir-fry, mixing with the vegetables and egg.
Pour in the coconut aminos. Continue to stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until the cauliflower is heated through and slightly browned.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

ingredients.name: Small Pasta (e.g., Ditalini or small shells)

steps: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add diced carrot and zucchini; sauté for 5 minutes.
Pour in the vegetable broth and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil.
Add the pasta and basil. Cook according to the pasta package directions.
Stir in the cannellini beans.
Continue to simmer until the pasta is al dente and the vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, optionally topped with Parmesan cheese.
Prepare the ramekins: Brush with melted butter and dust with Parmesan cheese. Refrigerate.
Make the béchamel base (panade): Melt butter, stir in flour, cook for 1 minute. Whisk in hot milk until thickened.
Remove from heat. Stir in egg yolks, Gruyère, and Parmesan. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Cool slightly.
Whip the egg whites: Beat egg whites with a pinch of cream of tartar until stiff, glossy peaks form.
Fold the whites: Gently fold one-third of the egg whites into the base mixture to lighten it, then fold in the remaining whites until just combined.
Pour the mixture into the prepared ramekins (do not fill all the way).
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 15-20 minutes until dramatically risen and golden brown.
Serve immediately, as soufflés deflate quickly.

ingredients.name: Kala Namak (Black Salt - for eggy flavor)

steps: Crumble the pressed tofu into a bowl using your hands to resemble scrambled eggs.
In a small bowl, mix turmeric, kala namak, nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté the diced onion and bell pepper until soft.
Add the crumbled tofu and the spice mixture to the skillet.
Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until the tofu is heated through and lightly browned in some spots.
Serve hot with toast or avocado.
Steam or boil the cauliflower florets until they are very tender (about 15-20 minutes).
Drain the cauliflower well and transfer it to a food processor or use a potato masher.
Add the softened cream cheese, heavy cream, butter, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Process or mash until smooth and creamy.
Stir in the shredded cheddar cheese until melted and incorporated.
Serve hot as a low-carb alternative to mashed potatoes.

recipeName: Thai Mango Sticky Rice (Khao Niao Mamuang)
steps: Rinse the sticky rice until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
Steam the soaked sticky rice for 20-30 minutes until soft and cooked through.
Make the sauce: Heat 3/4 of the coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan until sugar dissolves (do not boil).
Pour the coconut sauce over the warm, cooked sticky rice. Cover and let stand for 15 minutes to allow the rice to absorb the sauce.
Slice the mangoes. Serve a scoop of the coconut rice with sliced mango and drizzle with the remaining plain coconut milk (the topping sauce).
Garnish with toasted sesame seeds.
In a bowl, gently flake the drained salmon. Remove any large bones or skin pieces if desired.
Add the egg, almond flour, chopped dill, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Mix just until combined; do not overmix.
Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.
Heat avocado oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook the salmon patties for 4-5 minutes per side until golden brown and heated through.
Serve on lettuce wraps or with a side of steamed vegetables.

ingredients.name: Flax Egg (1 tbsp ground flax + 3 tbsp water)

steps: Prepare the flax egg and set aside to thicken.
In a large bowl, cream together the softened vegan butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Stir in the vanilla extract and the flax egg.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in the vegan chocolate chips.
Drop rounded spoonfuls of dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 9-11 minutes until the edges are golden brown.
Cool on the pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
In a large pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil.
Add the diced carrot, celery, and onion. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Stir in the egg noodles and dried parsley.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the noodles are tender.
Add the diced cooked chicken to heat through (if using raw chicken, add it with the vegetables).
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Grill or pan-sear the beef to medium-rare. Slice thinly against the grain.
Make the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the fish sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, and chili flakes.
In a large bowl, combine the mixed greens, sliced cucumber, mint, and cilantro.
Add the sliced warm beef to the salad.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat.
Serve immediately.
Rinse the basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear.
In a medium saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, heat the oil/ghee over medium heat.
Add the rinsed and drained rice and stir for 1 minute to toast it lightly.
Pour in the water and add salt. Bring the mixture to a rolling boil.
Immediately cover the pot, reduce the heat to the lowest setting, and simmer for exactly 15 minutes (do not lift the lid).
Remove the pot from the heat and let it stand, still covered, for 10 minutes.
Fluff the rice gently with a fork and serve.
Slice the pressed tofu into cutlets. Dredge each cutlet first in flour, then in the beaten egg, and finally coat thoroughly in panko breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry the tofu cutlets for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy. Drain and set aside.
Make the curry: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat and add the curry block pieces.
Stir constantly until the curry blocks are fully dissolved and the sauce thickens (about 5 minutes).
Serve the crispy tofu katsu over a bed of white rice, spooning the curry sauce over the top.
dietaryRestrictions: Vegan (using egg substitute and vegan panko/curry)

steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a microwave-safe bowl, combine mozzarella and cream cheese.
Microwave in 30-second intervals (about 1.5 minutes total), stirring between each, until completely melted and smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk together almond flour, baking powder, and garlic powder.
Quickly add the egg and the dry ingredients to the melted cheese mixture. Mix vigorously with a wooden spoon or stand mixer until a cohesive dough forms.
Place the dough between two sheets of parchment paper and roll into a 10-12 inch circle.
Bake the crust alone for 8-10 minutes until lightly set.
Remove, add low-carb toppings (e.g., tomato paste, low-carb veggies, meat), and bake for another 5-10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Make the sauce: Sauté onion and garlic in 2 tbsp olive oil. Stir in crushed tomatoes, herbs (thyme, rosemary), salt, and pepper. Spread the sauce evenly in a round baking dish.
Arrange the sliced eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, and tomato in alternating, overlapping circles on top of the sauce.
Drizzle the remaining 2 tbsp of olive oil over the arranged vegetables.
Cover the baking dish tightly with foil.
Bake for 40 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for another 15-20 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.
In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped shallots and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Pour in the Madeira wine and bring to a simmer. Cook until the wine is reduced by half (deglazing).
Add the beef broth and fresh thyme. Bring back to a simmer and continue to reduce until the sauce coats the back of a spoon (about 10-15 minutes).
Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve to remove the shallots and thyme.
Return the strained sauce to the saucepan. Stir in the heavy cream (if using) and whisk briefly.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately over Beef Wellington slices.

recipeName: Homemade Gnocchi with Sage Butter Sauce (Italian)
steps: Bake the potatoes until fully tender. Rice or pass the warm potatoes through a food mill onto a clean work surface. Allow to cool slightly.
Create a well in the center of the potatoes. Add the flour and egg yolk, salt, and pepper.
Gently mix the ingredients until a soft dough forms (do not over-knead).
Roll small portions of the dough into long ropes. Cut the ropes into 1-inch pieces (gnocchi).
Boil the gnocchi in salted water. They are done when they float to the surface (about 3 minutes).
While gnocchi boils, melt butter in a skillet. Add sage leaves and cook until the butter is brown and nutty (beurre noisette) and the sage is crispy.
Toss the drained gnocchi in the sage butter sauce. Serve immediately, topped with Parmesan.

recipeName: Simple Low-Cost Black Beans and Rice
steps: In a saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the cumin and chili powder. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the rinsed black beans and a splash of water (about 1/4 cup). Bring to a simmer.
Mash a small portion of the beans against the side of the pot to thicken the sauce.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Stir in the lime juice and serve the bean mixture over the cooked white rice.
Lay the bamboo mat flat and cover it with plastic wrap.
Place one sheet of Nori, shiny side down, on the mat.
Spread a thin, even layer of seasoned sushi rice over the Nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top edge.
Arrange a line of fish, avocado, and cucumber horizontally across the center of the rice.
Moisten the uncovered border edge with water. Lift the edge of the mat and roll the sushi tightly away from you.
Use the mat to squeeze the roll gently and ensure it holds its shape.
Slice the roll into 6-8 pieces using a sharp, wet knife.
Serve with soy sauce (or Tamari), wasabi, and pickled ginger.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with foil.
Toss the asparagus spears with olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Wrap a single strip of bacon tightly around a small bundle of 3-4 asparagus spears.
Place the bundles, seam-side down, on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the asparagus is tender-crisp.
Serve immediately.
Cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and diced onion; sauté until mushrooms are browned and tender.
Stir in the flour (or cornstarch/tapioca starch for GF) and cook for 1 minute.
Whisk in the vegetable broth, coconut cream, soy sauce/Tamari, and Dijon mustard.
Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss the cooked noodles with the stroganoff sauce and serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C). Place 4-6 shallow ramekins in a deep baking dish.
In a saucepan, heat the heavy cream, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla until the sugar dissolves (do not boil). Remove from heat.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks until just combined.
Slowly pour the warm cream mixture into the egg yolks while whisking constantly (tempering the yolks).
Strain the custard mixture into a measuring cup. Pour into the prepared ramekins.
Pour hot water into the baking dish (water bath) until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until the custard is set around the edges but still slightly jiggly in the center.
Remove from water bath, cool to room temperature, then chill for at least 4 hours.
Just before serving, sprinkle the chilled custard with a thin, even layer of sugar and use a kitchen torch to melt and caramelize it until deep golden brown.
Heat oil in a large pot. Add chicken and cook until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add ginger and curry powder to the pot. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the coconut milk, chopped cauliflower, and sweet potato. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Return the chicken to the pot and heat through.
Serve hot with basmati rice or quinoa.

recipeName: Simple Low-Cost Pasta Aglio e Olio
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente. Reserve at least 1/2 cup of the cooking water before draining.
While the pasta cooks, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over very low heat.
Add the sliced garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook gently for 5-7 minutes until the garlic is fragrant and pale golden (do not let it burn).
Add the drained pasta to the skillet.
Toss vigorously, adding the reserved pasta water a little at a time until the oil and water emulsify into a light sauce that coats the pasta.
Stir in the chopped fresh parsley and serve immediately.
Cook egg noodles according to package directions.
Season beef slices. Heat oil/butter in a skillet and quickly sear the beef in batches. Remove and set aside.
Add mushrooms and onion to the skillet; sauté until softened.
Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute.
Deglaze the pan with red wine (if using), scraping up browned bits. Cook until reduced by half.
Pour in the beef broth and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened.
Remove from heat. Stir in the sour cream until smooth (do not boil after adding sour cream).
Return the beef to the sauce and heat through. Serve immediately over the egg noodles.
In a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage and shredded carrots.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, sugar, celery seeds, salt, and pepper to create the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the vegetables.
Toss well to ensure all the vegetables are coated.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to blend and the cabbage to soften slightly.
Open the chilled coconut milk cans and scoop out the thick cream layer into a large bowl (discard or save the clear liquid).
Add the cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt to the coconut cream.
Use a hand mixer or whisk to beat the mixture until completely smooth and fluffy, ensuring no lumps of cocoa remain.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's directions (usually 20-30 minutes).
Transfer the churned ice cream to an airtight container and freeze for at least 4 hours to firm up.
Allow to thaw for 5-10 minutes before scooping.

recipeName: Keto Friendly Chicken Pot Pie Filling (No Crust)

ingredients.name: Mixed Keto Veggies (celery, onions, green beans)

steps: In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the keto vegetables and cook until tender.
Stir in the poultry seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Pour in the chicken broth and heavy cream. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Sprinkle the xanthan gum over the simmering mixture while whisking vigorously to thicken the sauce.
Stir in the shredded cooked chicken.
Transfer the mixture to a small casserole dish.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes to heat through and bubble slightly.
Serve hot.
Cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water immediately to stop the cooking process.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, drained tuna, thawed peas, and diced celery.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the pasta mixture.
Toss gently until everything is evenly coated.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Fill a small saucepan with 1 inch of water and bring to a simmer. Set a heatproof bowl over the simmering water (double boiler).

Add the egg yolks and cold water to the bowl. Whisk constantly and vigorously until the mixture thickens and lightens in color (about 5-7 minutes). The mixture should be thick enough to leave a ribbon trail.
Remove the bowl from the heat. Slowly stream in the warm melted butter while whisking constantly and rapidly. The sauce should emulsify and thicken.
Stir in the fresh lemon juice, salt, and cayenne pepper.
If the sauce is too thick, whisk in a few drops of warm water.
Serve immediately over eggs benedict or steamed asparagus.

recipeName: Vegan Roasted Red Pepper Pasta Sauce
steps: Soak cashews in hot water for at least 30 minutes, then drain.
In a food processor or high-speed blender, combine the drained roasted red peppers, soaked cashews, garlic, vegetable broth, nutritional yeast, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Blend until the sauce is completely smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides as needed.
Transfer the sauce to a saucepan and heat gently over low heat.
Toss with cooked pasta (or zucchini noodles for Keto/Paleo) and serve.
Create the 'raft': In a large pot, combine the chilled beef stock, ground beef, egg whites, diced mirepoix, and tomato paste. Stir well to combine (do not heat yet).
Place the pot over medium-high heat and slowly bring the mixture to a simmer without stirring (stirring will break the raft).
As the mixture heats, the ground beef and egg whites will solidify on the surface, forming a 'raft' that traps impurities and clarifies the stock.
Once the raft forms, reduce the heat to the lowest possible setting and simmer for 45-60 minutes.
Carefully create a small hole in the raft to allow the liquid to gently bubble and steam.
Remove from heat. Gently ladle the clear liquid (consommé) through the hole and strain it through a cheesecloth-lined sieve.
Season with salt, pepper, and a dash of sherry. Serve hot.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Prick each potato several times with a fork.
Rub the potatoes with olive oil and sprinkle generously with coarse salt.
Bake directly on the oven rack for 50-60 minutes, or until the skin is crispy and the interior is soft when squeezed.
Carefully slice the potato open lengthwise.
Fluff the interior with a fork. Top with butter, sour cream, and other desired toppings.
Serve hot.
Chill a mixing bowl and whisk attachment in the freezer for 10 minutes.
Open the chilled can of coconut cream and scoop out the thick cream layer (discard or save the liquid).
Place the cream into the chilled bowl.
Use an electric mixer to beat the coconut cream on high speed for 3-5 minutes until light and fluffy, resembling whipped cream.
Add the powdered sugar and vanilla extract and beat for another minute until combined.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.

ingredients.name: Heavy Cream (or coconut cream for DF)

steps: Marinate cubed chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry the marinated chicken until cooked through and slightly charred. Set aside.
In a large pot, melt butter/ghee. Sauté diced onion and ginger-garlic paste until fragrant.
Stir in the crushed tomatoes and the remaining spices (including garam masala). Simmer for 15 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to purée the sauce until smooth (optional, but classic).
Stir in the heavy cream and the cooked chicken. Bring to a low simmer.
Crush the kasuri methi between your palms and stir into the sauce. Serve hot with naan or rice.
dietaryRestrictions: Dairy Free (using oil/ghee and coconut cream)

steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Heat oil/butter in a cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Sauté the diced bell pepper and onion until softened.
Crack the eggs directly into the skillet, spacing them evenly among the vegetables.
Sprinkle the top of the skillet with the crumbled bacon and shredded cheddar cheese.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve immediately, optionally topped with avocado.

recipeName: Advanced Chocolate Lava Cakes (Moulleux au Chocolat)
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Generously butter and flour 4 small ramekins.
In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate and butter together, stirring until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk the whole eggs, egg yolks, and powdered sugar until pale and slightly thickened.
Fold the melted chocolate mixture into the egg mixture.
Gently fold in the flour just until combined.
Pour the batter evenly into the prepared ramekins.
Bake for exactly 12-15 minutes (this time is critical for the lava center), until the edges are firm but the center is soft.
Invert immediately onto a plate. Serve hot with a dusting of powdered sugar or vanilla ice cream.
Drain the soaked chickpeas well. Do NOT cook them.
In a food processor, pulse the soaked chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper until coarsely chopped (do not over-process into a paste).
Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat the oil in a deep pot to 350°F (175°C).
Carefully drop the falafel into the hot oil and fry in batches for 3-5 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on a paper towel. Serve hot in a pita or with tahini sauce.
In a large pot, brown the ground beef (or turkey). Drain excess fat.
Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the chili powder and cumin. Cook for 1 minute.
Pour in the crushed tomatoes and water/broth. Add the drained beans.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 30-45 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with shredded cheese or sour cream (optional).

recipeName: Paleo Chicken and Sweet Potato Hash
steps: Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the diced sweet potato and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender and slightly browned.
Add the diced onion and bell pepper. Cook until softened.
Stir in the diced cooked chicken, smoked paprika, and garlic powder.
Cook for 5 minutes, until the chicken is heated through and the flavors are blended.
Serve hot, optionally topped with a fried egg.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line an 8-inch round cake pan with parchment paper.
Melt the chocolate and butter together gently over a double boiler or in the microwave. Stir until smooth.
Whisk the sugar into the melted chocolate mixture until combined.
Whisk in the eggs one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract and salt.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center looks slightly underdone (it will continue to set as it cools).
Cool completely in the pan. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
In a jar or container, combine the chia seeds, plant milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir vigorously for 1-2 minutes to ensure all the seeds are wet and evenly distributed.
Cover the container and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight, until the mixture has thickened into a pudding consistency.
Stir again before serving.
Top with fresh berries, nuts, or granola.
Cook grits: Bring water/broth to a boil. Slowly whisk in the grits. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring frequently, until thickened and creamy (20-30 minutes).
Stir in the heavy cream, shredded cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper until creamy.
Cook the bacon (if using) until crispy. Remove bacon and reserve the fat.
Sauté the shrimp in the butter or bacon fat until pink and cooked through.
Serve the creamy grits immediately, topped with the sautéed shrimp and a sprinkle of bacon/parsley.
In a medium bowl, mash the avocados until they reach your desired consistency (chunky or smooth).
Stir in the diced red onion, chopped cilantro, minced jalapeño, and lime juice.
Season generously with salt and pepper.
Mix gently to combine all ingredients.
Taste and adjust the lime juice or seasoning as desired.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or as a side dish.
In a saucepan, combine the rolled oats, water/plant milk, and salt.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then immediately reduce the heat to a simmer.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the liquid is absorbed and the oats are creamy.
Stir in the brown sugar or maple syrup.
Pour into a bowl and top with sliced banana and a dash of cinnamon.
Serve immediately.
Melt the dark chocolate and water gently over a double boiler. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks with sugar until pale and thick.
Stir the melted chocolate mixture into the egg yolk mixture.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream and vanilla until soft peaks form.
In a clean bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff, glossy peaks form.
Gently fold one-third of the egg whites into the chocolate base to lighten it.
Fold in the remaining egg whites, then fold in the whipped cream until no streaks remain.
Spoon the mousse into serving glasses. Chill for at least 4 hours before serving.
In a saucepan, melt butter or heat oil over medium heat. Sauté the chopped onion and fresh mushrooms until softened and browned.
Add the condensed cream of mushroom soup to the saucepan.
Slowly whisk in the milk or broth until the soup reaches your desired consistency.
Stir in the dried thyme. Bring the soup to a simmer.
Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through.
Serve hot with crusty bread or crackers.
Heat oil in a large pot or pan. Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the ginger-garlic paste. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets. Stir in all the spice powders, salt, and pepper.
Add about 1/2 cup of water, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes and cauliflower are tender.
Uncover and cook on high heat for a few minutes to evaporate any excess liquid.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with roti or naan.
In a large pot, brown the ground beef. Drain excess fat.
Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, and smoked paprika. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the diced tomatoes, beef broth, and diced zucchini.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook for 30 minutes, uncovered, until the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream or shredded cheddar cheese.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs with milk/water, salt, and pepper until uniform.
Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat until it foams.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan.
Allow the edges to set slightly (about 1 minute), then gently push the cooked egg from the edges toward the center, tilting the pan to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath.
Continue cooking and folding until the eggs are mostly set but still slightly moist.
Remove from heat immediately and serve hot.
Discard any mussels that are open and do not close when tapped.
In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute (do not burn).
Pour in the white wine and bring to a rapid boil.
Add the mussels to the pot and cover tightly.
Steam for 5-7 minutes, shaking the pot occasionally, until all the mussels have opened.
Discard any mussels that did not open.
Stir in the fresh parsley and serve immediately in deep bowls with crusty bread for soaking up the broth.

recipeName: Paleo Grilled Pork Chops with Herbs
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, dried rosemary, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Rub the herb mixture generously onto both sides of the pork chops.
Grill the pork chops for 5-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
Remove from grill and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Serve with a side of steamed vegetables.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line an 8x8 inch pan with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the melted butter and granulated sugar until combined.
Whisk in the eggs one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the GF flour, cocoa powder, and salt.
Gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined (do not overmix).
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes. The edges should be set, and a toothpick inserted in the center should come out with moist crumbs.
Cool completely before slicing.
Heat oil in a large pot. Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add the crushed tomatoes and chana masala spice mix. Bring to a simmer.
Add the rinsed chickpeas and water/broth. Mash a few chickpeas against the side of the pot to help thicken the curry.
Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rice or roti.

recipeName: Keto Friendly Chicken Stir-fry with Shirataki Noodles
steps: Prepare the Shirataki noodles: Drain, rinse thoroughly, and dry-fry them in a skillet for 5 minutes to remove excess moisture.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet. Add the sliced chicken and stir-fry until cooked through. Remove and set aside.
Add the broccoli and mushrooms to the wok. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return the chicken to the wok. Add the prepared shirataki noodles.
Pour the Tamari and sesame oil over the mixture.
Toss quickly to coat and heat through. Serve immediately.
Cure the duck: Rub the duck legs with salt, thyme, pepper, and smashed garlic. Refrigerate, covered, for 12-24 hours.
Rinse the duck legs thoroughly to remove the salt and pat them completely dry.
Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Place the duck legs snugly in a deep oven-safe dish. Pour the melted duck fat over the legs until they are completely submerged.
Bake for 2.5 to 3 hours, or until the meat is fork-tender.
To serve: Remove the duck legs from the fat. Sear the skin side down in a hot skillet until the skin is deeply golden and crispy.
Serve with roasted potatoes.
Lay the two slices of bread flat on a clean surface.
Use a knife to spread an even layer of peanut butter on one slice of bread.
Use a knife to spread an even layer of jelly or jam on the other slice of bread.
Place the two slices together to form the sandwich.
Cut the sandwich in half diagonally or horizontally. Serve immediately.

recipeName: Vegan Baked Potatoes with Hummus and Chives
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Prick each potato several times with a fork.
Rub the potatoes with olive oil and sprinkle generously with salt.
Bake directly on the oven rack for 50-60 minutes, or until the skin is crispy and the interior is soft.
Carefully slice the potato open lengthwise.
Fluff the interior with a fork.
Top the baked potato generously with a scoop of hummus and a sprinkle of chopped chives and black pepper.
Serve hot.
Chop the raw shrimp into bite-sized pieces.
In a glass bowl, combine the shrimp and fresh lime juice. The lime juice will 'cook' the shrimp.
Refrigerate for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp is opaque and pink throughout.
Drain off most of the lime juice.
Gently stir in the diced red onion, tomato, cilantro, minced jalapeño, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or plantain chips.
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and carrot; sauté until soft.
Stir in the tomato paste and cumin. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the rinsed black beans and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to purée about half of the soup for a thicker consistency (or carefully transfer half to a regular blender).
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with a swirl of vegan sour cream or avocado.
In a medium bowl, combine the chopped hard-boiled eggs and diced celery.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the egg and celery mixture.
Fold in the chopped chives.
Mix gently until everything is evenly coated.
Serve on lettuce wraps, sliced cucumber, or by itself.

recipeName: Paleo Friendly Chicken Skewers with Veggies
steps: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least 30 minutes.
Toss the cubed chicken with olive oil, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Thread the chicken, bell pepper, zucchini, and red onion onto the skewers, alternating the ingredients.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the skewers for 4-6 minutes per side, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve immediately.
Make the sauce (tentsuyu): Combine dashi, soy sauce/Tamari, and mirin in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer and remove from heat.
Coat the dried tofu cubes evenly in potato starch.
Heat oil in a skillet to about 340°F (170°C).
Carefully fry the tofu cubes in batches for 3-5 minutes until golden brown and crispy on all sides. Drain on a paper towel.
Place the crispy tofu in a shallow bowl.
Pour a generous amount of the warm tentsuyu sauce over the tofu.
Garnish immediately with grated daikon and chopped green onion.
Serve hot.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve about 1/2 cup of the cooking water before draining.
In the same pot used for the pasta, melt the butter over low heat.
Stir in the garlic powder (if using), salt, and pepper.
Add the drained pasta to the pot.
Add the reserved pasta water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing vigorously until the butter and water emulsify into a light, creamy sauce that coats the noodles.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese (if using). Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a loaf pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the mashed bananas, plant milk, oil, and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
In a medium bowl, flake the drained tuna with a fork.
Add the mayonnaise, diced red onion, diced celery, sweet pickle relish (if using), and Dijon mustard.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix gently until all ingredients are well combined.
Serve on bread, in a lettuce wrap, or over a bed of mixed greens.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season the pounded chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and dried oregano.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken for 2-3 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Spoon the marinara sauce evenly over the top of the chicken breasts.
Top with the shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheese.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot.
In a bowl, toss the chicken strips with 1 tbsp olive oil, chili powder, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper.
In a separate bowl, toss the sliced peppers and onion with the remaining 1 tbsp of olive oil and a pinch of salt.
Heat a large skillet or cast iron pan over medium-high heat.
Add the seasoned vegetables and cook for 5-7 minutes until slightly charred and tender-crisp. Remove and set aside.
Add the chicken strips to the hot pan. Cook for 5-7 minutes until cooked through and slightly browned.
Return the vegetables to the pan and toss with the chicken.
Serve hot in a bowl with salsa and guacamole.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook the egg noodles al dente; drain.
In a large bowl, mix the condensed soup, milk, flaked tuna, frozen peas, salt, and pepper.
Stir in the cooked noodles.
Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch casserole dish.
Top with shredded cheddar cheese and crushed crackers.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until the topping is golden brown and the casserole is bubbling hot.
Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Roll the puff pastry thin and cut into three equal rectangles.
Prick the pastry all over with a fork to prevent excessive rising. Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown and crisp.
Cool the pastry completely on a wire rack.
Make the icing: Whisk together powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth and thick.
Assembly: Place one layer of puff pastry on a serving dish. Spread half of the pastry cream evenly over the top.
Place the second pastry layer on top and spread the remaining pastry cream.
Top with the third pastry layer. Spread the white icing over the top layer.
Draw parallel lines of melted chocolate or cocoa powder mixture across the icing. Drag a toothpick perpendicularly across the lines to create a marbled feathering effect.
Chill for at least 1 hour before slicing and serving.
Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Place one slice of bread, butter-side down, in a skillet over medium heat.
Place both slices of cheese on top of the bread.
Top with the second slice of bread, butter-side up.
Grill for 3-4 minutes until the bottom slice is golden brown. Flip the sandwich.
Grill for another 3-4 minutes until the second side is golden brown and the cheese is fully melted.
Serve immediately.
Heat oil in a large pot. Add the red curry paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the coconut milk. Stir until the paste is dissolved. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Add all the vegetables (broccoli, zucchini, bell pepper).
Season with brown sugar and a dash of salt.
Simmer gently for 10-15 minutes, until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve hot over jasmine rice.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the almond flour, psyllium husk powder, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites and apple cider vinegar.
Pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients and mix well.
Quickly pour in the boiling water and mix for about 30 seconds until a sticky dough forms.
Form the dough into a loaf shape or 6-8 small rolls.
Bake for 50-60 minutes until the bread is firm and golden brown.
Cool completely on a wire rack before slicing (this is essential).
In a large pot, brown the ground chicken/turkey in oil. Drain excess fat.
Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the chili powder and cumin. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the diced tomatoes, sweet potato, and chicken broth.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 30 minutes, or until the sweet potato is tender.
Serve hot, optionally topped with avocado or cilantro.
Soak rice noodles in hot water for 15-20 minutes until tender; drain.
Make the sauce: Whisk together fish sauce, tamarind paste, and brown sugar until sugar dissolves.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet. Sauté the shrimp until pink. Push to one side.
Pour the whisked eggs into the empty side of the pan and scramble quickly. Mix with shrimp.
Add the drained noodles and the sauce to the wok.
Toss and stir-fry everything for 3-5 minutes until the noodles are evenly coated and heated through.
Stir in the bean sprouts and chopped peanuts (if using). Serve immediately with a lime wedge.
